2947 North 78th Court
Elmwood Park, Illinois
60635
April 21, 1967 (Typed)
April 20, 1967 (Dictated)
National Assoc. of Educational Broadcasters
Mr. Jerrold Sandler
Executive Director
National Educational Radio
1346 Connecticut Avenue, N.W.
Washington, D.C. (20036)
Dear Sir:
RE: Pastore Sub-Committee Hearing
1, You are to be commended for your testimony for the Pastore Sub-Committee
(which I just saw last night). (I had previously written them that I thought ed¬
ucational radio broadcasting could do as good or better than half the ETV I have
seen so far and cost a heck of a lot less.) 1 have been a bit involved in educa¬
tional broadcasting since helping to build and operate two educational radio
(University) stations about 40 years ago-so I can appreciate your interest and
problems.
2. Since I serve on several school board and industry study groups, from local to
national level, I would like to have you send me any conveniently available material
on the operation of your group, and what is now being done on educational radio
in the United States; and also a copy of your submitted material to the Pastore
committee if available.
3, Even tho it does not all agree with the NAEB position, I am sending you a copy
of some response to FCC dockets 14185, 14229, and 16453. You might be interested
in a school board member's thinking on Docket 14185.
4. Again, thanks for pulling for educational radio. Remember Harry Skornia’s
comment about TV putting a nation to sleep and radio waking them up.
Lloyd P. Morris
LPM/em
cc enclosed
